newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's Senate approves three state debt deals.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's Senate approves three state debt deals.

text.p: The Brazilian Senate on Thursday approved debt-refinancing agreements between the federal government and the states of Rio de Janeiro, Goias and Rondonia, an official said.

In the largest of the three deals, the federal government agreed to roll over 11.3 billion reais of Rio de Janeiro's debt over 30 years, including 5.25 billion reais in state debt and a 3.4 billion real shortfall of failed state bank Banco do Estado do Rio de Janeiro SA.
A further 2.95 billion reais will be lent to the Rio government for the restructuring of its financial system.
The agreement was signed earlier this month by Finance Minister Pedro Malan and Rio officials but required Senate approval.
The value of the deals involving the less-developed states of Goias and Rondonia was not immediately clear.

The deals are the latest in a string of agreements reached by Brasilia with state governments, including heavily endebted Sao Paulo and Rio Grande do Sul, in an attempt to sort out the chaotic finances of local administrations.
